card.note: This coupon is good for one shopping trip with Brittany Tuosto.
card.author: Courtesy of Brittany Tuosto

card.note: Ronald is special to me because he was my confirmation sponsor.
card.author: John

card.note: Ronald is special to me because I told my 3rd grade teacher you were my older brother.
card.author: Christopher

card.note: Ronald is special to me because he will make sure I don't starve in college next year by taking me to Teresa's.
card.author: Samantha

card.note: Ronald is special to me because he became MY cousin too!
card.author: Nancy

card.note: Ronald is special to "US" because he keeps Christmas alive all year long!
card.author: Your Cousins

card.note: Ron is special to me because he has made his dad extremely proud of what he has become. A superior provider for his family and an extraordinary father to his children.
card.author: Dad

card.note: /RRons' transformation was not easy. As a young teenager he had to learn that investing hard saved monies with shisters doesn't pay./RThat not cleaning his room would result in his clothes being thrown out of his window and into the driveway./R
card.author: Dad

card.note: He had to learn that Superman was a fictional character and that he Ron couldn't fly./RHe couldn't sneak in through basement windows without being detected./RHe couldn't paint the garage walls with tar and not be punished./RLearned that going to school paid dividends.
card.author: Dad

card.note: Ron is special to me because not only is he my only sibling, aside from my husband, he is my best friend. Remember the days when I used to clean your room? Hee!Hee!Hee!
card.author: Love, Nino

card.note: He taught me what it meant to be a flyer fisher, ranger fan, and a man.
card.author: Michael Tuosto

card.note: Ron is special to me because he is more like a brother than a brother-in-law. He is warm, gregarious, welcoming and has a great laugh. I always look forward to seeing Ron at a family get-together because you know it will be a great time for all. Happy Father's Day!
card.author: Anthony

card.note: Ron- I remember you were always like a second father to me in high school. You always welcomed me with open arms into your home. I will never forget piling into the buick and going to the movies.
card.author: Jess Frisone

card.note: Thanks for a lifetime of friendship !!!! Also regards from the Gemini
card.author: Chris

card.note: Ron is special to me because he makes all my wishes come true
card.author: Teri

card.note: Ron is special because he always puts his family first
card.author: Teri

card.note: You make Christmas special for everyone. I believe in Santa Claus because I get the best presents
card.author: Teri

card.note: I am thankful everyday for you.... I love you very much
card.author: Teri

card.note: Ron is special because he takes it to the head, trying to get sun for Brittany and myself while boating in Disney
card.author: Teri

card.note: I know I can count on you for ranger ice cream
card.author: Teri

card.note: Buster...thanks for helping me learn to play golf
card.author: Teri

card.note: he opened 'er up!!!!
card.author: Michael Tuosto

card.note: He votes R up and down the ballot.
card.author: Michael Tuosto

card.note: Every kid deserves a great father like Ron. My kids are lucky they have an Uncle Ron in their life! /R/RI don't know where I'd be without your guidance and friendship. /R/RYou are a caring, dedicated and amazing father and I love you. /R/RHave a great Fathers Day.
card.author: Glen Donaldson

card.note: Ron is special because he helps me remember everyone's name. Finds my phone, fixes my car, waters my flowers, brings me my lunches when I forget them at home and he loves when I'm happy!!
card.author: Teri

card.note: Have you ever seen Frozen?
card.author: Brit

card.note: Dad:/R/RYour unconditional love and support have made me feel safe. I am the luckiest girl in the world to have been blessed with you as my father. I could never tell you often enough how much I love you.
card.author: Brit

card.note: I have always admired Ron for ALWAYS putting his family first. I feel very lucky to have worked with him for so many years!/RHe's the best!! /RHappy Father's Day, Ron!
card.author: Barbara

card.note: when he was born he was colic, and unless you experience a child like that you can never appreciate what I'm going to write. To keep him quiet I had to put him in the play pen with a newspaper or magazine to rip apart. At night I had to clean out the play pen..daily!
card.author: Mom

card.note: I would leave Ronald sitting in the baby tender locked. I walked into the dining room and His Majesty was on top of the washing machine which was close./R/RThe punishment for disobeying was to face a corner of the room sitting on a stool. Not Ronald. he got up, took my
card.author: Mom

card.note: One day Ronald took it upon himself to wash the kitchen floor by emptying a whole can of Ajax on the floor..I can't tell you how long it took to clean the floor!/R/RWe moved to 23rd Street whn Ronald was three years old. One day I had to run up the street to get Jeannine
card.author: Mom

card.note: from school. Ronald decides to eat a half of a pound of fried bacon which was on the counter for lunch./RHow would you like to hear your son at 5:30 am telling you "do you plan on staying in bed all day?"
card.author: Mom

card.note: One day, he was laying on the floor looking up at me and asked if he was adopted. My response was if you were adopted I would have sent you back a long time ago./R/RJeannine was in high school and Ronald had me all to himself for two years. When he would come through
card.author: Mom

card.note: the side door he would make me sit down on the step to hear his joke! I wad the censor for daddy. I told him the joke wasn't too bad, he could tell Daddy. Well, Mr. Tuosto takes his left hand puts it on Rons' right arm and said, you said it today,
card.author: Mom

card.note: you are not to repeat that joke again. Ron looked at me I at him and we bursting not to laugh./RNow I must add although he was a bit of a pain, he turned out to be a kind, caring and giving person. Any Mother would be proud of him as her son. My Champ!
card.author: Mom

card.note: "Never put anything in writing." ~ Ron Tuosto
card.author: Ian Healey

card.note: Thank you for being a great second family to me. I will never forget the Christmas morning outfits, trips, heading back from games, or just hanging around the house.
card.author: Ian Healey

card.note: Will never forget the "colorful" stories and commentary we have shared over the years, can not wait to do it again soon.
card.author: Ian Healey

card.note: Ron's friendship has always been something that we could on. Through thick and thin his support and good wishes helped make the tough times easier. ... and the good times better!
card.author: The Daidone Family

card.note: I still love Turner and Hooch and miss our campouts to this day.
card.author: Brit

card.note: Remember when Michael and I used to beat you up with your own slippers playing Bear?
card.author: Brit

card.note: Our many trips to Disney are still some of my favorite memories.
card.author: Brit
